feed.title: Perpetual Poppycock
feed.subtitle: For those suffering with decision, indecision.

entry.title: Let's try that again!
entry.summary: Full on PPS attack last night. Not only did I totally bail on any plans to work out after bedtime, I also did not even attempt personal time this morning due to an untimely bathroom break for my fur baby. Willy decided to wake up the entire house at 4

entry.title: 3.5 months and low carb strong
entry.summary:
It seems almost impossible to believe but I have been doing low carb, for 3.5 months. That has to be some kind of life achievement for me. I don’t anything long term. I am a quitter, generally speaking, and as you know I suffer severly from PPS.
This

entry.title: 3.5 weeks and 20 pounds later
entry.summary:
I did something. Something drastic, and extreme, and crazy, and totally unlike me. But, I did it.
The most amazing thing has happened. I woke up 3.5 weeks ago, the week before Thanksgiving otherwise known as the eating holiday, and I did a complete diet

entry.title: What Is Perpetual Poppycock?
entry.summary:
Do you ever have internal struggles with decisions or is indecision dominating your life? Well, that’s me. In a nutshell, I am a chronically bad decision maker.
I suffer from sever Perpetual Poppycock Syndrome. This blog is my attempt to force recovery
